channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rishi Sunak may have lost his $177,000 Prime Minister gig, but a multimillion-dollar corporate payday awaits the man richer than King Charles
item.description: Book deals, speaking engagements, and a return to finance will add to Sunak’s massive net worth.

item.title: While much of Europe embraces hard-right parties, the UK has just swung to the left. Here’s why
item.description: An unexpected political shift has gripped Europe over the last few years.

item.title: Exit poll shows Labour Party wins U.K. election in a landslide
Civics is becoming a 21st-century business skill
item.description: The very skills that formed the great experiment of democracy are the same skills that lead to breakthrough ideas and continued economic growth.

item.title: What a new Labour government means for investing in the UK
item.description: As Labour takes power in the U.K., experts weigh in on whether the change in government will impact stocks, bonds, the British pound and property markets.

item.title: U.S. stock and bond markets resume normal operations on Friday
Elon Musk’s Tesla recoups all its year-to-date losses after adding a staggering $150bn in market cap in just 3 days: ‘Worst is in the rear view mirror’
item.description: Investor faith in Tesla's once busted-growth story appears to have returned after a dire first-half that saw it become the butt of jokes.

item.title: Samsung shares hit over 3-year high after better-than-expected guidance on AI demand
item.description: Samsung said Friday it expects operating profit for the April to June quarter to be approximately 10.4 trillion won — a jump of about 1,452%.

item.title: This German mining town has renamed itself for Taylor Swift. Temporarily.
China’s BYD expands its reach into Southeast Asia as it inaugurates first EV plant in Thailand
item.description: The new factory in Rayong, south of Bangkok, was built in just 16 months and has an annual production capacity of 150,000 vehicles.

item.title: Trump ally Nigel Farage elected to British parliament for first time
item.description: After seven failed attempts, Nigel Farage has won a seat in the U.K.'s parliament.

item.title: If Biden drops out of the race, this is what will matter to the stock market
Elon Musk ghosts India on new Tesla factory investment
item.description: Musk’s team hasn’t made any further inquiries with officials in New Delhi after the billionaire postponed a visit to India in late April, sources said.

item.title: Nigel Farage's right-wing Reform UK party shocks with significant gains expected
item.description: The projected success of the right-wing Reform UK party, led by Brexiteer Nigel Farage, has surprised pollsters and the political establishment.

item.title: Britain’s Labour Party is set to win biggest majority since 1832, polling shows
